data.technical_notes: Initial project setup for Node.js/Express with SQLite and express-session for stateful auth supporting timeouts and logout. All patterns use async/await with Promise-wrapped sqlite3 callbacks, try/catch errors. Static frontend served from public/ on port 3000. Seeding happens on init for users table. Native test runner configured in package.json. No API endpoints yet - foundational only. Cross-cutting: Session middleware in server.js for all future auth/RBAC.

data.description: Create package.json with dependencies: express@^4.18.2, sqlite3@^5.1.6, bcrypt@^5.1.1, express-session@^1.17.3, dotenv@^16.3.1; devDependencies: nodemon@^3.0.1; scripts: {start: 'node src/server.js', test: 'NODE_ENV=test node --test'}; main: 'src/server.js'; type: 'commonjs'
Install Node.js dependencies via npm install
Install Node.js dependencies via npm install
Create .gitignore to ignore node_modules, .env, data.sqlite, *.log (for security and cleanliness)
Create .gitignore to ignore node_modules, .env, data.sqlite, *.log (for security and cleanliness)
Create .env.example with PORT=3000, DB_PATH=./data.sqlite, SESSION_SECRET=your-secret-key (instruct developer to copy to .env and set secret)
Create .env.example with PORT=3000, DB_PATH=./data.sqlite, SESSION_SECRET=your-secret-key (instruct developer to copy to .env and set secret)

Create src/db.js: Implement createDb factory returning sqlite3.Database (use process.env.DB_PATH || './data.sqlite' for prod, ':memory:' if NODE_ENV=test); Implement initDb async function: Create users table if not exists (fields: id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, email TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL, password_hash TEXT NOT NULL, role TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'employee', created_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now'))); In initDb, check if users table empty (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users), if 0, seed exactly 1 admin (per AC: 'admin@test.com / Password123! hashed with bcrypt', role 'admin') and 5 sample employee records (e.g., emails: john@company.com (role 'employee'), jane@company.com, mike@company.com, sarah@company.com, david@company.com; use generic names/passwords like 'employee1' hashed); Wrap all sqlite3 ops in Promises for async/await; Use try/catch; Export { createDb, initDb }

Create src/server.js: Require dotenv and config(); Require express, create app; Require session and use with config (secret: process.env.SESSION_SECRET || fallback, cookie maxAge 1800000, httpOnly true, secure false, sameSite 'lax', resave false, saveUninitialized false); app.use(express.json()); app.use(express.static('public')); Require db and await initDb(createDb()); Basic route: app.get('/', (req, res) => res.sendFile(path.join(__dirname, '../public/index.html'))); Error handler: app.use((err, req, res, next) => res.status(500).json({success: false, error: err.message})); Export app; If require.main === module, const port = process.env.PORT || 3000; app.listen(port, () => console.log(`Server on port ${port}`)); Use async/await and try/catch

Create public/index.html: Basic HTML page with

Welcome to BrightHR Lite

, link to login (e.g., Login); Include placeholders for CSS/JS if needed; Ensure responsive and accessible basics

Create README.md with Mac setup steps: 1. Install Node.js v18+ via Homebrew (brew install node). 2. Clone repo. 3. Copy .env.example to .env and set SESSION_SECRET. 4. npm install. 5. npm start. 6. Access http://localhost:3000. 7. For tests: npm test (uses in-memory DB). Note Mac-specific: Ensure writable dir for data.sqlite, M1/M2 compatible, allow localhost:3000 in firewall if prompted
Create README.md with Mac setup steps
